skill.name: git-analysis
skill.description: Analyze git repository changes, branch differences, and commit history. Use when analyzing branches, comparing changes, examining commit history, or preparing for PR/commit operations.
skill.summary: Analyze git repository changes, branch differences, and commit history. Use when analyzing branches,...
skill.author: 1natsu172

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate git analysis tool containing standard shell scripts for git repository operations. All 183 static findings are false positives. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' HIGH findings were triggered by YAML/JSON metadata fields and git format specifiers that the scanner misidentified. All external command patterns are necessary git commands (git log, git diff, git merge-base) for read-only repository analysis. No network calls, credential theft, or malicious code exists. This skill only performs read operations on local git repositories.

content.value_statement: Understanding git repository changes requires running multiple commands and parsing output. This skill automates branch analysis, commit history extraction, and file change statistics for faster code review and PR preparation.
actual_capabilities: Extract structured commit history with statistics
Identify changed files and line change counts
Get default branch and remote configuration
limitations: Only works with local git repositories
Requires git to be installed and available
Cannot analyze remote repository history directly
Does not modify or create commits

use_cases.title: Code review preparation
use_cases.description: Extract branch changes and commit history for code review discussions

use_cases.title: PR description generation
use_cases.description: Gather commit lists and file changes for pull request descriptions

use_cases.title: Change tracking
use_cases.description: Monitor branch activity and track what changed between branches

prompt_templates.title: Basic branch analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the current branch and show what commits and files have changed compared to the default branch

prompt_templates.title: Commit history extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract the commit history from the merge base to HEAD in structured format with author and date information

prompt_templates.title: File change summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how many files changed, insertions, and deletions in the current branch

prompt_templates.title: Full analysis report
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a complete analysis of the current branch including default branch, merge base, commit count, and detailed change statistics

output_examples.input: Analyze the current branch and show what changed compared to main
Show me the structured commit history
Get a summary of changed files

best_practices: Always use merge base for comparison instead of current branch state
Run independent git commands in parallel for faster results
Structure output in consistent format for easier parsing
anti_patterns: Comparing from branch tip instead of merge base
Running commands sequentially when parallel execution is possible
Ignoring error messages from git commands

faq.question: Which git versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with git 2.0 and above. Most modern systems have compatible versions.

faq.question: What is the maximum commit count for analysis?
faq.answer: No hard limit. Performance depends on repository size and git command efficiency.

faq.question: Can this skill create or modify commits?
faq.answer: No. This skill only analyzes existing repository state. Use other tools for commit operations.

faq.question: Is my repository data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This tool only reads repository data using standard git read-only commands.

faq.question: What if merge base cannot be determined?
faq.answer: The scripts will show an error message and exit. Ensure you are on a branch with commits.

faq.question: How is this different from git log?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured output and combines multiple git commands for comprehensive analysis.
